text:
Hello.
I would like to develop an extension with UI Extensions according to the following URL but it doesn't work, please let me know
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-quickstart>
I am setting up a development environment following the steps below, but I get an error at step 6.
1.npm install -g @HubSpot/cli@latest
2.hs init
3.hs project create
4.cd <project-template-directory>
5.npm install
6.hs project dev（<Test on a new development sandbox>）
--
The error message is as follows
```[ERROR] A StatusCodeError has occurred. 403 - {"status":"error","message":"You can't create/archive a development sandbox for portal 〇〇〇〇.","correlationId":"〇〇-〇〇-〇〇-〇〇-〇〇","context":{"hubId":["〇〇〇〇"]},"category":"BANNED","subCategory":"SandboxErrors.DEVELOPMENT_SANDBOX_ACCESS_NOT_ALLOWED"}```

Hi Ryo, my guess is that your primary portal (as configured in the CLI) is not on an Enterprise subscription to Sales or Service Hub, which is a requirement to use development sandboxes. There is more information about the setup for local development with projects on this documentation page (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/developer-projects-setup>) which you might find helpful.

<@U056ZR8LVJQ>
Hi Roger
To set up a local environment, personal access key will need the following scopes
But why can't I select a scope?
・developer.projects.write
・developer.app_functions.read
・developer.app_functions.write
Do you mind sending your portal ID over a direct message and I can help investigate further?
